intro: Claoxylon fallax, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountain forests. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture and forestry.
